definitions.definition: A high-pitched, short and somewhat sharp sound.
examples: My car used to make an odd ping , but after the last oil change it went away.

definitions.definition: A pulse of high-pitched or ultrasonic sound whose echoes provide information about nearby objects and vessels.
examples: The submarine sent out a ping and got an echo from a battleship.

definitions.definition: A packet which a remote host is expected to echo, thus indicating its presence.
examples: The network is overloaded from all the pings going out.

definitions.definition: An email or other message sent requesting acknowledgement.
examples: I sent a ping to the insurance company to see if they received our claim.

definitions.definition: A means of highlighting a feature on the game map so that allied players can see it.

main_definition: A high-pitched, short and somewhat sharp sound.
secondary_definitions: ( submarine navigation ) A pulse of high-pitched or ultrasonic sound whose echoes provide information about nearby objects and vessels.
( networking ) A packet which a remote host is expected to echo, thus indicating its presence.
( text messaging , Internet ) An email or other message sent requesting acknowledgement.
( video games ) A means of highlighting a feature on the game map so that allied players can see it.
